title: Critical damage bonus on Jhin
body:
So I was thinking that using critical damage runes on Jhin would be a good idea. Thoughts?

Oh and btw what is his actual ad based of crit and as?

replies.body: For pure shits and gigs.  I tried I think it was about 38% crit damage like 5% attack speed .. And played I the jg . Admittedly it was slow and painful but that 4th shot chunks so hard.   After I got Ie  I could 4th shot nasus at 1/3 hp or more ..  And his ult 4th shot crit scales with  crit damage from IE and runes I went well didn't die it was pretty fun tbh
Did that Nasus rush Bloodthirster and then sell his items and get two thornmails?

The maximum critical strike bonus you can get from runes is 45.51%. 

This is good because **Jhin** has a reduction of 25% critical strike damage, meaning you'll make up for it, plus have some extra damage. The problem is, you can just buy an **Infinity Edge** for 50% bonus critical strike damage, and take normal runes.

Looks like we'll need more time too see what's viable/optimal, but I theorise that full attack speed **Jhin** will be the preferred build.

> Oh and btw what is his actual ad based of crit and as?

This is straight from the wiki:

_"Additionally, his attack damage is increased by 2% - 40% (based on level) (+ 4% per 10% critical chance) (+ 2.5% per 10% bonus attack speed)."_

Read more about that [here](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Jhin), if you're interested.

For his Crit 100 % crit would give 40% bonus AD, and with his attack speed at 155% boost would give you 80% on the movement speed proc, and the attack speed bonus is 2.5 per 10% so with attack speed being 155% would mean that 2.5 * 15 = 37.5 bouns damage with you're autos 

in total 37.5 / 0.40 = 93.75 bonus damage for this example

so crit dmg runes may not be a bad idea will try them out :)
